title.value: V-JEPA: Latent Video Prediction for Visual Representation Learning
title.justification: This is the title of the paper.
title.quote: V-JEPA: Latent Video Prediction for Visual Representation Learning

extractions.description: The paper introduces V-JEPA, a self-supervised learning method that predicts masked spatio-temporal regions in a learned representation space of videos, to produce visual features that excel in various downstream tasks.

type.justification: The paper presents empirical results demonstrating the effectiveness of the V-JEPA model on various benchmark datasets.
type.quote: Our latent video prediction strategy produces visual features that can be applied to various downstream image and video tasks without adaption of the model’s parameters, achieving 82.1% on Kinetics-400 and 71.2% on Something-Something-v2...

name.justification: The paper focuses on visual representation learning from video data.
name.quote: We introduce V-JEPA, a method for self-supervised learning from video that predicts masked spatio-temporal regions in a learned representation space.

name.justification: The paper proposes a method for self-supervised learning from videos.
name.quote: We introduce V-JEPA, a method for self-supervised learning from video that predicts masked spatio-temporal regions in a learned representation space.

name.justification: The method focuses on learning useful representations from video data.
name.quote: Our latent video prediction strategy produces visual features that can be applied to various downstream image and video tasks without adaption of the model’s parameters.

name.justification: V-JEPA is the main model introduced by the paper.
name.quote: We introduce V-JEPA, a method for self-supervised learning from video that predicts masked spatio-temporal regions in a learned representation space.

is_contributed.justification: The model is introduced as the main contribution of the paper.
is_contributed.quote: We introduce V-JEPA, a method for self-supervised learning from video that predicts masked spatio-temporal regions in a learned representation space.

is_executed.justification: The paper includes results from experiments with V-JEPA showing its performance on various tasks.
is_executed.quote: Our latent video prediction strategy produces visual features that can be applied to various downstream image and video tasks without adaption of the model’s parameters.

is_compared.justification: The performance of V-JEPA is compared with other state-of-the-art models in the paper.
is_compared.quote: We achieve 71.2% top-1 frozen evaluation on Something-Something-v2, surpassing VideoMAE, DINOv2 and OpenCLIP by +10, +21, and +32 points respectively...

referenced_paper_title.justification: This model is introduced in the current paper and therefore does not have a reference paper.
referenced_paper_title.quote: We introduce V-JEPA, a method for self-supervised learning from video that predicts masked spatio-temporal regions in a learned representation space.

name.justification: The paper compares the performance of V-JEPA with the VideoMAE model.
name.quote: On visual tasks that require a semantic temporal understanding of a scene, such as action classification on SSv2...we find V-JEPA to provide a significant boost in frozen evaluation over the largest state-of-the-art image and video models, such as VideoMAE.

is_contributed.justification: This model was referenced, not contributed by the authors of the paper.
is_contributed.quote: On visual tasks that require a semantic temporal understanding of a scene, such as action classification on SSv2...we find V-JEPA to provide a significant boost in frozen evaluation over the largest state-of-the-art image and video models, such as VideoMAE.

is_executed.justification: There is no indication that VideoMAE was executed in this paper.
is_executed.quote: On visual tasks that require a semantic temporal understanding of a scene, such as action classification on SSv2...we find V-JEPA to provide a significant boost in frozen evaluation over the largest state-of-the-art image and video models, such as VideoMAE.

is_compared.justification: The paper compares V-JEPA's performance against VideoMAE.
is_compared.quote: On visual tasks that require a semantic temporal understanding of a scene, such as action classification on SSv2...we find V-JEPA to provide a significant boost in frozen evaluation over the largest state-of-the-art image and video models, such as VideoMAE.

referenced_paper_title.value: VideoMAE: Masked Autoencoders are Data-Efficient Learners for Self-Supervised Video Pre-Training
referenced_paper_title.justification: The paper provides the title of the VideoMAE reference paper.
referenced_paper_title.quote: VideoMAE (Tong et al., 2022) directly extend the masked autoencoder approach to spatio-temporal volumes by training an encoder-decoder model to predict masked spatio-temporal voxels.

name.justification: The paper compares the performance of V-JEPA with the DINOv2 model.
name.quote: Specifically, we achieve 71.2% top-1 frozen evaluation on Something-Something-v2, surpassing VideoMAE, DINOv2 and OpenCLIP by +10, +21, and +32 points respectively...

is_contributed.justification: This model was referenced, not contributed by the authors of the paper.
is_contributed.quote: Specifically, we achieve 71.2% top-1 frozen evaluation on Something-Something-v2, surpassing VideoMAE, DINOv2 and OpenCLIP by +10, +21, and +32 points respectively...

is_executed.justification: There is no indication that DINOv2 was executed in this paper.
is_executed.quote: Specifically, we achieve 71.2% top-1 frozen evaluation on Something-Something-v2, surpassing VideoMAE, DINOv2 and OpenCLIP by +10, +21, and +32 points respectively...

is_compared.justification: The paper compares V-JEPA's performance against DINOv2.
is_compared.quote: Specifically, we achieve 71.2% top-1 frozen evaluation on Something-Something-v2, surpassing VideoMAE, DINOv2 and OpenCLIP by +10, +21, and +32 points respectively...

referenced_paper_title.value: DINOv2: Learning Robust Visual Features without Supervision
referenced_paper_title.justification: The paper provides the title of the DINOv2 reference paper.
referenced_paper_title.quote: The DINOv2 method of Oquab et al. (2023) combines an invariance-based loss with a masked-image modelling loss and is currently the most competitive instantiation of self-supervised learning with (static) images, scaled to a model with over 1.1B parameters trained on a curated dataset of 142M images.

name.justification: The paper compares the performance of V-JEPA with the OpenCLIP model.
name.quote: Specifically, we achieve 71.2% top-1 frozen evaluation on Something-Something-v2, surpassing VideoMAE, DINOv2 and OpenCLIP by +10, +21, and +32 points respectively...

is_contributed.justification: This model was referenced, not contributed by the authors of the paper.
is_contributed.quote: Specifically, we achieve 71.2% top-1 frozen evaluation on Something-Something-v2, surpassing VideoMAE, DINOv2 and OpenCLIP by +10, +21, and +32 points respectively...

is_executed.justification: There is no indication that OpenCLIP was executed in this paper.
is_executed.quote: Specifically, we achieve 71.2% top-1 frozen evaluation on Something-Something-v2, surpassing VideoMAE, DINOv2 and OpenCLIP by +10, +21, and +32 points respectively...

is_compared.justification: The paper compares V-JEPA's performance against OpenCLIP.
is_compared.quote: Specifically, we achieve 71.2% top-1 frozen evaluation on Something-Something-v2, surpassing VideoMAE, DINOv2 and OpenCLIP by +10, +21, and +32 points respectively...

referenced_paper_title.value: Learning Transferable Visual Models from Natural Language Supervision
referenced_paper_title.justification: The paper provides the title of the OpenCLIP reference paper.
referenced_paper_title.quote: OpenCLIP (Radford et al., 2021) trains a video encoder to predict the representation of video captions computed by a text encoder.

name.justification: The paper evaluates the V-JEPA model on the Kinetics-400 dataset.
name.quote: Our latent video prediction strategy produces visual features that can be applied to various downstream image and video tasks without adaption of the model’s parameters, achieving 82.1% on Kinetics-400...

referenced_paper_title.value: The Kinetics Human Action Video Dataset
referenced_paper_title.justification: The referenced paper title for the Kinetics-400 dataset is provided.
referenced_paper_title.quote: On tasks that require good image-level features, such as Kinetics and ImageNet, we observe that V-JEPA is an effective pretraining strategy.

name.justification: The paper evaluates the V-JEPA model on the Something-Something-v2 dataset.
name.quote: We obtain the first unsupervised video model to achieve 82.1% top-1 frozen evaluation accuracy on Kinetics, without any fine-tuning, outperforming the previous best video model, VideoMAE, by +4.2 points. Similarly, V-JEPA obtains 77.9% top-1 on ImageNet, without any image fine-tuning.

referenced_paper_title.value: The 'Something Something' Video Database for Learning and Evaluating Visual Common Sense
referenced_paper_title.justification: The referenced paper title for the Something-Something-v2 dataset is provided.
referenced_paper_title.quote: On visual tasks that require a semantic temporal understanding of a scene, such as action classification on SSv2 or action localization on AVA, we find V-JEPA to provide a significant boost in frozen evaluation...

name.justification: The paper evaluates the V-JEPA model on the ImageNet dataset.
name.quote: ...V-JEPA trains a visual encoder by predicting masked spatio-temporal regions in a learned latent space. On visual tasks that require a semantic temporal understanding of a scene, such as action classification on SSv2...

referenced_paper_title.value: ImageNet Large Scale Visual Recognition Challenge
referenced_paper_title.justification: The referenced paper title for the ImageNet dataset is provided.
referenced_paper_title.quote: Specifically, we achieve 77.9% top-1 on ImageNet, without any image fine-tuning.

name.justification: PyTorch is commonly used for implementing such models and is likely used in this work given its prevalence in the field.

referenced_paper_title.justification: No specific reference is made to PyTorch in the paper.
